member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.RenderingTree.Components.FormattedText.Tools.UnicodeDecodingConformance
member.summary: Controls how Unicode characters are interpreted by the WebUtility.HtmlDecode routine.
member.remarks: See http://www.w3.org/International/questions/qa-escapes#bytheway for more information on how Unicode characters in the SMP are supposed to be encoded in HTML.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.RenderingTree.Components.FormattedText.Tools.UnicodeDecodingConformance.Auto
member.summary: The Unicode encoding behavior is determined by current application's TargetFrameworkAttribute. Framework40 and earlier gets Compat behavior; Framework45 and later gets Strict behavior.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.RenderingTree.Components.FormattedText.Tools.UnicodeDecodingConformance.Strict
member.summary: Specifies that the incoming encoded data is checked for validity before being decoded. For example, an input string of "𣎴" would decode as U+233B4, but an input string of "��" would fail to decode properly.
member.remarks: Already-decoded data in the string is not checked for validity. For example, an input string of "\ud800" will result in an output string of "\ud800", as the already-decoded surrogate is skipped during decoding, even though it is unpaired.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.RenderingTree.Components.FormattedText.Tools.UnicodeDecodingConformance.Compat
member.summary: Specifies that incoming data is not checked for validity before being decoded. For example, an input string of "�" would decode as U+D84C, which is an unpaired surrogate. Additionally, the decoder does not understand code points in the SMP unless they're represented as HTML-encoded surrogates, so the input string "𣎴" would result in the output string "𣎴".

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.RenderingTree.Components.FormattedText.Tools.UnicodeDecodingConformance.Loose
member.summary: Similar to 'Compat' in that there are no validity checks, but the decoder also understands SMP code points. The input string "𣎴" will thus decode into the character U+233B4 correctly.
member.remarks: This switch is meant to provide maximum interoperability when the decoder doesn't know which format the provider is using to generate the encoded string.

member.summary: Creates simplified eval context, sufficient to populate data tree.

member.summary: Find latest possible line break position before 'lineBreakPos'.
member.param: If False, kinsoku rules will be ignored.
If True, non-japanese words can be splitted.
The source text locates at the start of the line.
member.returns: Line break position.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.Tools.Kinsoku.WithEndLineChars(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
End line characters (\n and \r\n) should be included to line break algorithm. It allows to fix the problem with double line dividing in RDF: first time - during RDF saving, second time - during real rendering of already divided string.
Note: the behavior is slightly different from GDI, because GDI does not include end line symbols if kinsoku rools don't allow to divide the string. But we must exclude double dividing...

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Rendering.Tools.Kinsoku.CanBreak(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if line can be broken at specified position.
member.param: Should the not japan word is broken.
member.returns: True, if line can be broken at specified position.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Core.Rendering.ReportParameters.ParameterType.Integer
member.summary: Specifies an integral number.
member.remarks: For a calendar date format the date string as follows: YYYY-MM-DD For example 2003-04-01 represents the first day of April in 2003. For a date and time, format the string as follows: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss Note that the T serves a seperator between the date and time. For example 2003-04-01T13:01:02 represents one minute and two seconds after one o'clock in the afternoon of 2003-04-01. Without any further additions, a date and time is assumed to be in a local time zone. To indicate the time is measured in UTC, you can append a capital letter Z to the end of the time string.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeCaptionPosition.Below
member.summary: The below

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle
member.summary: Type of code, or symbology, the barcode control will use to generate the barcode.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.None
member.summary: None.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Ansi39
member.summary: ANSI 3 of 9 (Code 39) uses upper case, numbers, - , * $ / + %.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Ansi39x
member.summary: ANSI Extended 3 of 9 (Extended Code 39) uses the complete ASCII character set.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Code_2_of_5
member.summary: Code 2 of 5 uses only numbers.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Code25intlv
member.summary: Interleaved 2 of 5 uses only numbers.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Matrix_2_of_5
member.summary: Matrix 2 of 5 is a higher density barcode consisting of 3 black bars and 2 white bars. Matrix_2_of_5 uses only numbers.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Code39
member.summary: Code 39 uses numbers, % * $ /. , - +, and upper case.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Code39x
member.summary: Extended Code 39 uses the complete ASCII character set.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Code_128_A
member.summary: Code 128 A uses control characters, numbers, punctuation, and upper case.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Code_128_B
member.summary: Code 128 B uses punctuation, numbers, upper case and lower case.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Code_128_C
member.summary: Code 128 C uses only numbers.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Code_128auto
member.summary: Code 128 Auto

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Code_93
member.summary: Code 93 uses the complete ASCII character set.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Code93x
member.summary: Extended Code 93 uses the complete ASCII character set.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.MSI
member.summary: MSI Code uses only numbers.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.PostNet
member.summary: PostNet uses only numbers with a check digit.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Codabar
member.summary: Codabar uses A B C D + - : , / and numbers.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.EAN_8
member.summary: EAN-8 uses only numbers (7 numbers and a check digit).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.EAN_13
member.summary: EAN-13 uses only numbers (12 numbers and a check digit). If there are only 12 numbers in the string, it calculates a checksum and adds it to the thirteenth position. If there are 13, it validates the checksum and throws an error if it is incorrect.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.UPC_A
member.summary: UPC-A uses only numbers (11 numbers and a check digit).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.UPC_E0
member.summary: UPC-E0 uses only numbers. Used for zero-compression UPC symbols. For the Caption property, you may enter either a six-digit UPC-E code or a complete 11-digit (includes code type, which must be 0 (zero)) UPC-A code. If an 11-digit code is entered, the Barcode control will convert it to a six-digit UPC-E code, if possible. If it is not possible to convert from the 11-digit code to the six-digit code, nothing is displayed.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.UPC_E1
member.summary: UPC-E1 uses only numbers. Used typically for shelf labeling in the retail environment. The length of the input string for U.P.C. E1 is six numeric characters.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.RM4SCC
member.summary: Royal Mail RM4SCC uses only letters and numbers (with a check digit). This is the barcode used by the Royal Mail in the United Kingdom.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.UCCEAN128
member.summary: UCC/EAN –128 uses the complete ASCII character Set. This is a special version of Code 128 used in HIBC applications.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.QRCode
member.summary: QRCode is a 2D symbology that is capable of handling numeric, alphanumeric and byte data as well as Japanese kanji and kana characters. This symbology can encode up to 7,366 characters.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Code49
member.summary: Code 49 is a 2D high-density stacked barcode. Encodes the complete ASCII character set.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.JapanesePostal
member.summary: This is the barcode used by the Japanese Postal system. Encodes alpha and numeric characters consisting of 18 digits including a 7-digit postal code number, optionally followed by block and house number information. The data to be encoded can include hyphens.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Pdf417
member.summary: Pdf417 is a popular high-density 2-dimensional symbology that encodes up to 1108 bytes of information. This barcode consists of a stacked set of smaller barcodes. Encodes the full ASCII character set. Capable of encoding as many as 2725 data characters.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.EAN128FNC1
member.summary: EAN-128 is an alphanumeric one-dimensional representation of Application Identifier data. It is not meant for point-of-sales use, but for marking containers in the shipping industry.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.RSS14
member.summary: RSS14 is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is a 14-digit EAN.UCC item identification for use with omnidirectional point-of-sale scanners.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.RSS14Truncated
member.summary: RSS14Truncated is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is a 14-digit EAN.UCC item identification plus Indicator digits for use on small items, not for point-of-sale scanners.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.RSS14Stacked
member.summary: RSS14Stacked is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is the same as RSS14Truncated, but stacked in two rows when RSS14Truncated is too wide.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.RSS14StackedOmnidirectional
member.summary: RSS14StackedOmnidirectional is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is the same as RSS14, but stacked in two rows when RSS14 is too wide.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.RSSExpanded
member.summary: RSSExpanded is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is a 14-digit EAN.UCC item identification plus AI element strings (expiration date, weight, etc.) for use with omnidirectional point-of-sale scanners.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.RSSExpandedStacked
member.summary: RSSExpandedStacked is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is the same as RSSExpanded, but stacked in two rows when RSSExpanded is too wide.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.RSSLimited
member.summary: RSS Limited is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is a 14-digit EAN.UCC item identification with indicator digits of 0 or 1 in a small symbol that is not scanned by point-of-sale scanners.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.DataMatrix
member.summary: Data Matrix is a high density, two-dimensional barcode with square modules arranged in a square or rectangular matrix pattern.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.MicroPDF417
member.summary: MicroPDF417 is two-dimensional (2D), multi-row symbology, derived from PDF417. Micro-PDF417 is designed for applications that need to encode data in a two-dimensional (2D) symbol (up to 150 bytes, 250 alphanumeric characters, or 366 numeric digits) with the minimal symbol size.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.MicroQRCode
member.summary: Micro QR Code is a variant of QR Code, with reduced barcode size. It has only one position detection pattern.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.MaxiCode
member.summary: MaxiCode is special polar barcode.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.GS1QRCode
member.summary: GS1 QRCode

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.GS1DataMatrix
member.summary: GS1 Data Matrix

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Aztec
member.summary: Aztec Code

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.IntelligentMail
member.summary: Intelligent Mail, formerly known as the 4-State Customer Barcode, is a 65-bar code used for domestic mail in the U.S.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.ITF14
member.summary: Interleaved Two of Five. This code is used to mark cartons and palettes that are including goods with an EAN-13 code. One digit is added in front of the EAN-13 code to mark the packing variant.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Code_11
member.summary: Encodes the numbers 0 through 9, the hyphen (-), and start/stop characters. It is primarily used in labeling telecommunications equipment.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.SSCC_18
member.summary: SSCC_18 is an 18-digit Serial Shipping Container Code. It is used to identify individual shipping containers for tracking purposes.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Telepen
member.summary: Telepen has 2 different modes - alphanumeric-only and numeric-only. Both modes require a start character, a check digit, and a stop character. It is mainly used in manufacturing industries.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Pharmacode
member.summary: Pharmacode represents only numeric data from 3 to 131070. It is a barcode standard used in the pharmaceutical industry for packaging. It is designed to be readable despite printing errors.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.PZN
member.summary: PZN Pharmaceutical Central/General Number uses the same encoding algorithm as Code 39 but can carry only digits – 0123456789. The number of digits supported for encoding are 6 or 7. The letters 'PZN' and checksum digit are automatically added. It is mainly used to identify medicine and health-care products in Germany and other German-speaking countries.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.HIBCCode128
member.summary: HIBCCode128 barcode uses the Code128 symbology. It encodes 'Primary Data' and 'Secondary Data' using slash (/) as delimiter. It is used in the health care products industry for identification purpose.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.HIBCCode39
member.summary: HIBCCode39 barcode uses the Code39 symbology, with Code39OptionalCheckDigit property set to True. It encodes 'Primary Data' and 'Secondary Data' using slash (/) as delimiter. It is used in the health care products industry for identification purpose.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.ISBN
member.summary: International Standard Book Number barcode is a special form of the EAN-13 code and is used as a unique 9-digit commercial book identifier.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.ISSN
member.summary: International Standard Serial Number barcode is a special form of the EAN-13 code. It is used to identify serial publications, publications that are issued in numerical order, such as the volumes of a magazine.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.ISMN
member.summary: Internationally Standard Music Number barcode is a special form of the EAN-13 code. It is used for marking printed musical publications.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.IATA_2_of_5
member.summary: IATA_2_of_5 is a variant of Code_2_of_5 and uses only numbers with a check digit.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.BC412
member.summary: Data BC412 uses 35 characters, 0 - 9 and A - Z. It is designed for semiconductor wafer identification.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.Plessey
member.summary: Plessey uses hexadecimal digits to encode. It is a one-dimensional barcode used mainly in libraries.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeStyle.IntelligentMailPackage
member.summary: IntelligentMailPackage is more efficient in terms of processing and tracking mails than Intelligent Mail barcode.

member.summary: Specifies the print direction of the barcode symbol.

member.summary: The barcode symbol is printed left to right (default).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeDirection.RightToLeft
member.summary: The barcode symbol is printed right to left.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeDirection.TopToBottom
member.summary: The barcode symbol is printed top to bottom.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Barcode.BarCodeDirection.BottomToTop
member.summary: The barcode symbol is printed bottom to top.

member.summary: Defines the orientation of the bars in the barcode.

member.summary: None

member.summary: 180 degrees

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Layout.ILayoutManager.Measure(GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Layout.LayoutContext)
member.devdocs: Current implementation of layout subsystem assumes that this method will return actual extents encapsulated into . Nevertheless, it may be sufficient to return only approximate partial size (low end approximation) as long as the layout manager knows that the item (content being measured) will exceed current page dimensions ( for more details) for the current target device and a complete accurate measurement of the item is expensive.
member.summary: A query by the layout system of what the results of a call to Layout would be with the specified settings.
member.returns: indicating outcome of this operation

member.remarks: This method should return the exact size of the content laid out encapsulated into .

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Layout.LayoutCapabilities
member.summary: Specifies what layout options are available for the report item. This enumeration is used with the property.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Layout.LayoutCapabilities.None
member.summary: The report item size remains fixed regardless of the contents.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Layout.LayoutCapabilities.CanShrinkVertically
member.summary: The report item can shrink vertically to fit the contents.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Layout.LayoutCapabilities.CanShrinkHorizontally
member.summary: The report item can shrink horizontally to fit the contents.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Layout.LayoutCapabilities.CanGrowVertically
member.summary: The report item can grow vertically to fit the contents.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Layout.LayoutCapabilities.CanGrowHorizontally
member.summary: The report item can grow horizontally to fit the contents.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Layout.LayoutCapabilities.CanSplitVertically
member.summary: When the contents do not fit, the top portion of the report item can be rendered on the current page and the bottom portion on the following page. The default behavior is for the entire report item to move to the following page.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Layout.LayoutCapabilities.CanSplitHorizontally
member.summary: When the contents do not fit, the left portion of the report item can be rendered on the current page and the right portion on the following page. The default behavior is for the entire report item to move to the following page.

member.summary: US Carrier with postal codes up to 9 digits in length. Approximately 138 numeric characters may be encoded in this mode.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.BarCodes.MaxiCodeMode.Mode3
member.summary: International Carrier with alpha-numeric postal codes up to 6 digits in length. Approximately 93 characters may be encoded in this mode.

member.summary: Standard Symbol encodes general information for purposes other than the shipping industry. Approximately 90 characters may be encoded in this mode.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.BarCodes.MaxiCodeMode.Mode5
member.summary: Secure Symbol encodes general information with more error correction. Approximately 74 characters may be encoded in this mode.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.BarCodes.MaxiCodeMode.Mode6
member.summary: Reader Program allows scanner manufacturers to program barcode readers.

member.name: T:ZXing.EncodeHintType
member.summary: These are a set of hints that you may pass to Writers to specify their behavior.
member.author: dswitkin@google.com (Daniel Switkin)

member.name: F:ZXing.EncodeHintType.ERROR_CORRECTION
member.summary:
Specifies what degree of error correction to use, for example in QR Codes. Type depends on the encoder. For example for QR codes it's type
For Aztec it is of type , representing the minimal percentage of error correction words. In all cases, it can also be a representation of the desired value as well. Note: an Aztec symbol should have a minimum of 25% EC words. For PDF417 it is of type or (between 0 and 8),

member.name: F:ZXing.EncodeHintType.CHARACTER_SET
member.summary: Specifies what character encoding to use where applicable. type:

member.name: F:ZXing.EncodeHintType.AZTEC_LAYERS
member.summary: Specifies the required number of layers for an Aztec code. A negative number (-1, -2, -3, -4) specifies a compact Aztec code 0 indicates to use the minimum number of layers (the default) A positive number (1, 2, .. 32) specifies a normal (non-compact) Aztec code type: , or representation of the integer value
